revision.text:
{{Infobox song | name = Say Something | cover = Say Something - Justin Timberlake (Official Single Cover).png | alt = | type = single | artist = [[Justin Timberlake]] featuring [[Chris Stapleton]] | album = [[Man of the Woods]] | released = {{start date|2018|01|25}} | format = * [[Music download|Digital download]] * [[Streaming media|streaming]] | recorded = | studio = | genre = [[Country pop]] | length = 4:39 | label = [[RCA Records|RCA]] | writer = * [[Justin Timberlake]] * [[1500 or Nothin'|Larrance Dopson]] * [[Danja (record producer)|Floyd Nathaniel Hills]] * [[Timbaland|Timothy Mosley]] * [[Chris Stapleton|Christopher Stapleton]] | producer = * Justin Timberlake * Timbaland * Danja * Larrance Dopson | chronology = [[Justin Timberlake]] | prev_title = [[Supplies (song)|Supplies]] | prev_year = 2018 | next_title = [[SoulMate (Justin Timberlake song)|SoulMate]] | next_year = 2018 | misc = {{Extra chronology | artist = [[Chris Stapleton]] | type = single | prev_title = [[Broken Halos]] | prev_year = 2017 | title = Say Something | year = 2018 | next_title = [[Millionaire (Chris Stapleton song)|Millionaire]] | next_year = 2018 }} {{External music video|{{YouTube|8MPbR6Cbwi4|"Say Something"}}}} }} "'''Say Something'''" is a song recorded by American singer-songwriter [[Justin Timberlake]] featuring vocals by American singer [[Chris Stapleton]]. It was released on January 25, 2018 as the third single from his fifth studio album ''[[Man of the Woods]]'' (2018) along with its music video. The song was written and produced by Timberlake, [[1500 or Nothin'|Larrance Dopson]], [[Danja (record producer)|Floyd Nathaniel Hills]], and Timbaland, with additional songwriting by Stapleton. It debuted at number 9 on the US [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]], becoming Timberlake's 19th top 10 single as a solo artist and Stapleton's first.<ref name="hot 100"/> It also reached number one in Slovakia and Slovenia and the top 10 in Austria, Belgium, Canada, Czech Republic, Germany, Hungary, the Netherlands, Poland, Scotland, Switzerland, and the United Kingdom. It was serviced to [[contemporary hit radio]] on February 13, 2018.<ref name="radio release">{{Cite news |url=https://www.allaccess.com/top40-mainstream/future-releases |title=Top 40 Mainstream Future Releases |date=February 14, 2018 |work=All Access Music Group |access-date=February 14, 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180209215514/https://www.allaccess.com/top40-mainstream/future-releases |archive-date=February 9, 2018}}</ref> A live version of the song was released on March 31. "Say Something" received a nomination for [[Grammy Award for Best Pop Duo/Group Performance|Best Pop Duo/Group Performance]] at the [[61st Annual Grammy Awards]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.grammy.com/grammys/news/2019-grammy-awards-complete-nominations-list |title=2019 GRAMMY Awards: Complete Nominations List |date=December 7, 2018 |work=[[The Recording Academy]] |accessdate=December 7, 2018}}</ref>
==Background== Justin Timberlake and Chris Stapleton first collaborated at the [[49th Annual Country Music Association Awards|2015 Country Music Association Awards]], performing "[[Tennessee Whiskey (song)|Tennessee Whiskey]]" and "[[Drink You Away]]".<ref>{{cite news|last1=Moss|first1=Marissa R.|title=See Chris Stapleton and Justin Timberlake's Stunning CMA Awards Duet|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/see-chris-stapleton-and-justin-timberlakes-stunning-cma-awards-duet-20151104|accessdate=November 5, 2015|work=Rolling Stone|date=November 4, 2015}}</ref> Stapleton was initially only writing songs with Timberlake for the album, before being asked to sing on "Say Something". He told ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'', "I really just went out to [[Los Angeles]] to write songs with him, it's a very fluid process with him, there's a lot going on. That was one of those things where there wasn't necessarily a plan. He was like 'All right, you hop in there and take a verse,' and I'm like, 'You want me to do what?' ... It came out great. I had a blast with him, he's a great creative force and one of those guys that if you get a chance to work with him, you should."<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/8096846/chris-stapleton-justin-timberlake-say-something-man-of-the-woods-grammys-interview|title=Chris Stapleton Talks Working With Justin Timberlake on 'Say Something' & His Sneaky Appearance on 'Filthy'|magazine=Billboard|first=Taylor|last=Weatherby|date=January 29, 2018|accessdate=February 1, 2018}}</ref>
==Composition and interpretation== "Say Something" is an upbeat [[country rock]] ballad that blends the [[electronic music|electronic]] structures of ''Man of the Woods'' previously released songs "[[Filthy (song)|Filthy]]" and "[[Supplies (song)|Supplies]]" with Stapleton's [[country blues]] styles.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Renner Brown |first=Eric |date=January 25, 2018 |title=Justin Timberlake and Chris Stapleton release country-rock duet |url=http://ew.com/music/2018/01/25/justin-timberlake-chris-stapleton-say-something |magazine=Entertainment Weekly |accessdate=January 25, 2018}}</ref> The song comprises elements of [[gospel music|gospel]], [[pop music|pop]], [[Soul music|acoustic soul]] and [[jazz]].<ref name="CMT">{{Cite news |url=http://www.cmt.com/news/1790563/justin-timberlake-and-chris-stapletons-say-something-says-everything/ |title=Justin Timberlake and Chris Stapleton's "Say Something" Says Everything |last=Tingle |first=Lauren |date=January 25, 2018 |work=CMT |accessdate=January 25, 2018}}</ref> Timberlake and Timbaland previously incorporated country sounds such as twangy guitars on tracks like "[[What Goes Around... Comes Around]]".<ref name="upprox">{{Cite news |url=http://uproxx.com/music/justin-timberlake-chris-stapleton-say-something/ |title=Justin Timberlake And Chris Stapleton's 'Say Something' Collaboration Is Finally Here |last=Williams |first=Aaron |date=January 25, 2018 |work=Uproxx |accessdate=January 25, 2018}}</ref> The song features lyrics about reflection and regret, meditating on social pressure to have something to say and being unsure if you really do. ''[[Nashville Scene]]'' writer Stephen Trageser interpreted the lyrics as: {{quote|"...recognizing that someone with the degree of celebrity Timberlake has can do more good by taking up less space. As in, realizing that weighing in on issues of public concern can easily turn into an event focused on him and his image instead of actually serving the cause at hand."<ref name="nashville scene">{{Cite news |url=https://www.nashvillescene.com/music/nashville-cream/article/20990189/watch-justin-timberlake-and-chris-stapleton-work-the-room-in-say-something-fresh-vid |title=Watch Justin Timberlake and Chris Stapleton Work the Room in 'Say Something' [Fresh Vid] |last=Trageser |first=Stephen |date=January 25, 2018 |work=Nashville Scene |access-date=January 25, 2018}}</ref>}}
==Music video== [[File:Bradbury Atrium 2011.JPG|thumb|upright=1|right|Staircases and atrium interior of the [[Bradbury Building]]]] Directed by Arturo Perez Jr. and produced by La Blogothèque, the video was filmed using a technique known as "continuous motion" and shot in one take at the [[Bradbury Building]] in Los Angeles – famous for its appearance in the 1982 cult science fiction film ''[[Blade Runner]]'' – with elevators, balconies, and stairs that "personified the labyrinth" the concept required.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Vallejo-Lopez |first=Abdiel |date=January 25, 2018 |title=Watch Justin Timberlake's "Say Something" Video, Featuring Chris Stapleton |url=https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2018/01/watch-justin-timberlakes-say-something-music-video.html |magazine=Paste |accessdate=January 25, 2018}}</ref><ref name="mtv">{{Cite news |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/3060789/justin-timberlake-chris-stapleton-say-something-video/ |title=Justin Timberlake's Stunning New Video with Chris Stapleton Was Done in One Take |last=Roth |first=Madeline |date=January 25, 2018 |work=MTV |access-date=January 25, 2018}}</ref> The crew included 17 musicians and a 60-person choir, in order to record the video and audio live in only one take.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Miller |first=Matt |date=January 26, 2018 |title=Justin Timberlake's Stunning |url=http://www.esquire.com/entertainment/music/a15895135/justin-timberlake-say-something-video-director-interview/ |magazine=Esquire |access-date=January 26, 2018}}</ref> The video starts with Timberlake alone in a room creating beats and effects on an [[Music Production Center|MPC]] [[sampler (musical instrument)|sampler]]. The camera follows him as he straps on an acoustic guitar and ascends up an elevator. Stepping out, he encounters Stapleton on a nearby staircase.<ref name="billboard">{{Cite magazine |last=Maher |first=Natalie |date=January 25, 2018 |title=Justin Timberlake Drops His Latest Single 'Say Something' With Chris Stapleton |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/8096279/justin-timberlake-say-something-chris-stapleton |magazine=Billboard |accessdate=January 25, 2018}}</ref> The music video on [[YouTube]] has received over 330 million views as of January 2020.
It won Best Live Video at the [[2018 UK Music Video Awards]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.musicweek.com/talent/read/childish-gambino-florence-the-machine-win-big-at-uk-music-video-awards/074242 |title=Childish Gambino, Florence + The Machine win big at UK Music Video Awards |last=Paine |first=Andre |date=October 25, 2018 |work=Music Week |accessdate=October 25, 2018}}</ref> It received nominations for Video of the Year and Collaborative Video of the Year at the 2018 [[CMT Music Awards]],<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://variety.com/2018/music/news/2018-cmt-music-awards-nominations-1202801817/ |title=CMT Music Awards Nominations Revealed; Little Big Town to Host |last=Brockington |first=Ariana |date=May 8, 2018 |work=Variety |access-date=May 8, 2018}}</ref> for an [[MTV Video Music Award for Best Direction]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/cardi-b-the-carters-childish-gambino-drake-lead-2018-vma-nominations-699523/|title=VMAs 2018: Cardi B, the Carters, Childish Gambino, Drake Lead Nominations|date=July 16, 2018|accessdate=July 17, 2018|first=Ryan|last=Reed|work=Rolling Stone}}</ref> and for an [[iHeartRadio Much Music Video Awards|iHeartRadio Much Music Video Award]] for Best Director.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.iheartradio.ca/news/shawn-mendes-leads-2018-iheartradio-mmvas-nominations-1.4703119 |title=Shawn Mendes Leads 2018 iHeartRadio MMVAs Nominations |last=Kennedy |first=John R. |date=August 1, 2018 |work=iHeartRadio |accessdate=August 1, 2018}}</ref> It also received a nomination for Best Music Video at the 2018 [[Camerimage|Camerimage Festival]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://camerimage.pl/nominacje-w-konkursie-wideoklipow-4/ |title=Nominacje W Konkursie Wideoklipow |work=Camerimage |access-date=October 3, 2018 |location=Poland}}</ref>
==Critical reception== Lauren Tingle of [[CMT (U.S. TV channel)|CMT]] gave the song a positive review, writing "it definitely sounds like it could have been born in Timberlake's musically rich home state of Tennessee. The pop singer's high tenor and Stapleton's gravely melisma accent the song's driving acoustic rhythm guitars, horns and syncopated percussion."<ref name="CMT"/> In ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'', Natalie Maher stated the climax of the song occurs "as the two are joined by a full choir, and added band, and then slowly comes down off itself with the line, "maybe it's greatest to say nothing.""<ref name="billboard"/> Stephen Trageser of ''[[Nashville Scene]]'' deemed the track "an anthemic tune about something ostensibly honorable," and went on to interpret the lyrics.<ref name="nashville scene"/> Cillea Houghton of ''[[Taste of Country]]'' called the song a "jam" where the singer "trade lines on an upbeat, genre-less track that could easily nestle into country radio."<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://tasteofcountry.com/justin-timberlake-chris-stapleton-song-say-something/ |title=Hear Justin Timberlake and Chris Stapleton's "Say Something" |last=Houghton |first=Cillea |date=January 25, 2018 |work=Taste of Country |accessdate=January 25, 2018}}</ref> Emily Yahr of ''[[The Washington Post]]'' said the song "has a guitar-driven sound that could theoretically fit into the modern country world."<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/arts-and-entertainment/wp/2018/01/25/can-justin-timberlake-and-chris-stapleton-recreate-that-epic-cma-moment-with-say-something/ |title=Can Justin Timberlake and Chris Stapleton recreate that epic CMA moment with 'Say Something'? |last=Yahr |first=Emily |date=January 25, 2018 |work=The Washington Post |access-date=January 25, 2018}}</ref> ''Billboard''{{'}}s critics ranked it among the best songs of the first half of 2018.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/list/8459289/best-songs-of-2018-top-50|title=The 50 Best Songs of 2018 (So Far): Critics' Picks|work=Billboard}}</ref>
[[Uproxx]]'s Aaron Williams opined the blend of styles created "a surprisingly danceable groove that isn't too far off from Timberlake's usual comfort zone," and added "their voices also blend well."<ref name="upprox"/> Will Lavin of ''[[Joe (website)|Joe]]'' expressed "Say Something" is a "more refined Justin Timberlake. It feels like an organic blend of musical elements. From the hip hop-inspired drums, to the country-driven guitar riff, gospel harmonies, and triumphant introspective vocals, you're left feeling satisfied... this is JT at his best and most honest."<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.joe.co.uk/entertainment/justin-timberlake-reveals-one-shot-music-video-for-say-something-159365 |title=Justin Timberlake reveals one shot music video for "Say Something" |last=Lavin |first=Will |date=January 25, 2018 |work=Joe |access-date=January 25, 2018}}</ref> Forrest Wickman of ''[[Slate (magazine)|Slate]]'' said the "long-anticipated duet lives up to the hype."<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://slate.com/culture/2018/01/justin-timberlake-and-chris-stapletons-say-something-video-lives-up-to-the-hype.html |title=Justin Timberlake and Chris Stapleton's Long-Anticipated Duet Lives Up to the Hype |last=Wickman |first=Forrest |date=January 25, 2018 |work=Slate |access-date=January 25, 2018}}</ref> For [[Idolator (website)|Idolator]], Mike Neid said it is "the first song that truly feels on brand with the more organic styling of ''Man of the Woods''. It feels like a bit of a risk for JT, but it is one that should pay off," and opined it was the "best" on the album so far.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.idolator.com/7674070/justin-timberlake-chris-stapleton-say-something |title=Justin Timberlake & Chris Stapleton's "Say Something" Is The Best 'Man Of The Woods' Single Yet |last=Neid |first=Mike |date=January 25, 2018 |work=Idolator |access-date=January 25, 2018}}</ref> HotNewHipHop said it is different from his previous singles as it leans towards [[folk music]], "but it's still another solid offering from Timberlake."<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.hotnewhiphop.com/justin-timberlake-releases-new-single-say-something-feat-chris-stapleton-new-song.1977114.html |title=Justin Timberlake Releases New Single "Say Something" Feat. Chris Stapleton |date=January 25, 2018 |work=HotNewHipHop |access-date=January 25, 2018}}</ref> In a guitar video tutorial for this song, musician Scott Mathson says that learning the song on guitar is simple, as it contains "pretty easy guitar chords".<ref>{{cite web |url=https://scottmathson.com/blog/music/2018/01/28/guitar-tutorial-chords-lyrics-say-something-justin-timberlake/|title=Guitar Chords, Tabs, & Lyrics - Say Something by Justin Timberlake & Chris Stapleton - Scott Mathson, Maker|website=scottmathson.com}}</ref> [[MTV]]'s Madeline Roth said the song is "as close to Timberlake's Memphis roots as he's gotten so far... and it's a promising sign of things to come,"<ref name="mtv"/> while [[MTV (UK and Ireland)|MTV UK]]'s Sam Prance stated Timberlake "deliver some of the best vocals of his career to date. Not to mention, the chorus is massive and Chris complements Justin perfectly on it."<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.mtv.co.uk/justin-timberlake/news/justin-timbelake-releases-epic-new-single-say-something|title=Justin Timberlake Releases Epic New Single 'Say Something'|work=MTV UK}}</ref>
''[[Pitchfork (website)|Pitchfork]]''{{'}}s Marc Hogan in an unfavorable review said "apparently, the two have nothing to say, and they're absurdly proud of it."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://pitchfork.com/reviews/tracks/justin-timberlake-say-something-ft-chris-stapleton/|title="Say Something" [ft. Chris Stapleton] by Justin Timberlake Review - Pitchfork|website=pitchfork.com}}</ref> ''[[Spin (magazine)|Spin]]''{{'}}s Winston Cook-Wilson felt it is not the single for a listener that is "looking for clever, poignant, or just remotely sensical turns of phrase.".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.spin.com/2018/01/review-justin-timberlake-say-something/|title=Review: Justin Timberlake – "Say Something"|date=25 January 2018|publisher=}}</ref>
''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' named "Say Something" the ninth best song of 2018 on their year-end list.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://ew.com/music/2018/12/05/the-10-best-songs-of-2018/ |title=The 10 best songs of 2018 |last=December 5, 2018 |date=December 5, 2018 |work=Entertainment Weekly |access-date=December 5, 2018}}</ref> ''Billboard'' critics ranked it as the 74th best song of the year.<ref>https://www.billboard.com/articles/events/year-in-music-2018/8489483/best-songs-2018-staff-picks</ref>
==Commercial performance== In the United States, "Say Something" debuted at number nine on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] with 98,000 downloads sold, after selling additional 21,000 before the tracking week, and 12.8 million streams. It also marked Timberlake's seventh number one on [[Digital Songs]], and first since "[[Can't Stop the Feeling!]]" in 2016.<ref name="hot 100">{{cite web|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/8098078/drake-gods-plan-hot-100-justin-timberlake-say-something|title=Drake's 'God's Plan' Still No. 1 on Hot 100, Justin Timberlake & Chris Stapleton's 'Say Something' Debuts in Top 10|work=Billboard|last=Trust|first=Gary|date=February 5, 2018|accessdate=February 6, 2018}}</ref> The song has sold 431,000 downloads in the country as of June 2018.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://roughstock.com/news/2018/06/43103-top-30-digital-country-tracks-june-20-2018|title=Top 30 Digital Country Singles: June 20, 2018 |work=Roughstock|last=Bjorke|first=Matt|date=June 21, 2018 |accessdate=July 5, 2018 }}</ref>
In 2018, "Say Something" was ranked as the 85th most popular song of the year on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.billboard.com/charts/year-end/2018/hot-100-songs|title=Billboard 2018 Year End Charts|website=Billboard}}</ref>
In 2019, "Say Something" was certified Platinum in the UK exactly one year after its release, becoming his sixth Platinum seller in the country as a solo artist.<ref>https://www.bpi.co.uk/brit-certified/</ref>
==Live performances== On February 5, 2018, Timberlake and Stapleton performed "Say Something" on the post-[[Super Bowl LII|Super Bowl]] episode of ''[[The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon]]''.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/super-bowl-justin-timberlake-reveals-how-prince-tribute-happened-1081673 |title=Super Bowl: Justin Timberlake Reveals How the Prince Tribute Happened |last=Nordyke |first=Kimberly |date=February 5, 2018 |work=The Hollywood Reporter |access-date=February 5, 2018}}</ref> On February 21, 2018, both artists performed the song at the [[2018 Brit Awards]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/8213549/justin-timberlake-brit-awards-performance-chris-stapleton|title=Justin Timberlake Kicks Off 2018 Brit Awards With 'Midnight Summer Jam' & 'Say Something' With Chris Stapleton|work=Billboard|last=Maher|first=Natalie|date=February 21, 2018|accessdate=February 25, 2018}}</ref>
"Say Something" has also been performed at every show on Timberlake's sixth concert tour, ''[[The Man of the Woods Tour]]''.<ref>{{cite web|work=[[The Charlotte Observer]]|date=January 9, 2019|accessdate=January 12, 2019|title=Concert review: How was Justin Timberlake's Charlotte show?|author=Théoden Janes|url=https://www.charlotteobserver.com/entertainment/music-news-reviews/article224095115.html}}</ref>
==Track listing== {{Track listing | headline = Digital download | title1 = Say Something | note1 = featuring Chris Stapleton | length1 = 4:38 }}
{{Track listing | headline = Digital download<ref name="live version">{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/ca/album/say-something-feat-chris-stapleton-live-version-single/1363301658|title=Say Something (feat. Chris Stapleton) [Live Version] – Single|work=iTunes Store (CA)|accessdate=March 31, 2018}}</ref> | title1 = Say Something | note1 = live version) (featuring Chris Stapleton | length1 = 4:02 }}
==Credits and personnel== *[[Justin Timberlake]] – production, vocal production, guitar *[[Timbaland]] – production *[[Danja (record producer)|Danja]] – production *[[Larrance Dopson]] - additional production *[[Chris Stapleton]] – featured vocals, guitar *Chris Godbey – engineer *Ben Sedano – assistant engineering *Elliot Ives – guitar
